conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the refractive index of the transparent body ABDE and how it affects the travel time of light from point O to the AB boundary.
The refractive index of the transparent body ABDE is given as √2. This means that the speed of light in the transparent body is twice the speed of light in a vacuum.
The travel time t can be calculated using the formula t = d/v, where d is the distance and v is the speed of light.
Since the refractive index is √2, the speed of light in the transparent body is v = 2 × c, where c is the speed of light in a vacuum.
The distance d is the length of the AB boundary.
Using the formula t = d/v, we can calculate the travel time t as t = d / (2 × c).
Since the length of the AB boundary is not provided, we cannot calculate the exact value of t.
The travel time t for light to travel from point O to the AB boundary is directly proportional to the refractive index and the speed of light. The relationship is t = d / (2 × c).
